title: How to Trade Pokémon Cards

steps.headline: Figure out what Pokémon cards you really want.
steps.description: Before you trade, it is essential that you have an idea of what Pokémon cards you want.

steps.headline: Find then cards you’re willing to trade away.
steps.description: In order to trade, you’ll have to make some sacrifices. Find the cards you are willing to trade away, and prepare them for trade.

steps.headline: Find someone to trade with.
steps.description: It could be someone who you know has a card you want, someone who wants a card you have, or just a friend.

steps.headline: Ask if you may look at their cards they are willing to trade.
steps.description: Majority of players have a separate stack of cards pre-set aside for trading. This is important, as it's very impolite and rude to look at someone's trading cards without asking first. Remember to take you time. You shouldn’t feel rushed. Take your time to thoroughly go through their cards.

steps.headline: Sift through the cards until you find the one you might want.
steps.description: Be sure you really want the card(s); you can’t afford to make a bad trade!

steps.headline: See if the trade you’re about to make is a fair one.
steps.description: Don’t make the trade if it is a bad trade. Check their HP and attack, for it is a good way to see if it is a fair trade. If the cards have similar HP and attack power, then the trade is good.

steps.headline: Ask the owner of the card if they are willing to trade the card(s)you picked.
steps.description: If the owner says yes, then give him your card(s) and take the other card(s).

steps.headline: Battle.
steps.description: Sometimes, an owner may say no. To convince them to trade, invite them to a battle. When you battle, your opponent gets to see your cards in action. They may change their mind!

steps.headline: Have fun with your new Pokémon cards.
